architectural_notes: Add image upload optimization pipeline (e.g., client/server-side compression/resizing) to improve reliability and performance.
Ensure a consistent user identity mapping layer: always resolve/display human-readable username (handle) rather than principal/ID; define fallback behavior when username is missing.
known_issues: Image upload feature does not work properly (user-reported).
Username displays as a principal-like identifier (e.g., "67jkd-p6hqj-...") instead of the user’s chosen username.

existing_features.title: Make image uploads reliable across all post-creation UIs by standardizing validation, preprocessing, and error handling for uploaded images before sending them to the canister.
Optimize image uploads on the client by automatically resizing and compressing images before converting them to ExternalBlob, to reduce upload time and avoid failures from large image payloads.
Add a new “quick reactions” feature (emoji reactions) for plushie feed posts, allowing authenticated users to react with one of several predefined emojis and see reaction counts per post.

Fix user profile lookup so the app can reliably resolve a Principal to a UserProfile username, instead of falling back to showing a principal-like identifier (e.g., "67jkd-p6hqj-...") when rendering authors.
Update the main plushie feed post UI to display the author’s saved username (from the user profile) instead of a truncated principal string.

Update comment and group post/comment UIs to display the commenter/author’s saved username (from the user profile) instead of truncated principal strings, matching the behavior already used in Collection/Discussion post cards.

new_feature_requests.summary: Fix and optimize image upload functionality (reliability + upload optimization/compression)

Add backend-side validation for image-based post creation to prevent traps with unclear causes and to reduce "Failed to create post" occurrences by returning consistent, user-friendly error messages for invalid inputs.
Fix username display: app shows principal/canister-style identifier (e.g., "67jkd-p6hqj-...") instead of the user’s actual username

projectName: Optimize image uploads (reliability + compression) and add emoji reactions
